subject: Re: [junit] @Before vs constructor
msgSnippet: On Thu, Oct 23, 2008 at 2:20 AM, Joakim Ohlrogge ... But if this were the case, @After would be pointless, wouldn t it? How many of your tests would suddenly
messageBody:
On Thu, Oct 23, 2008 at 2:20 AM, Joakim Ohlrogge
<joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
> I think that there would be some unhappy JUnit users out there if we
> got one instance shared between all tests in the class. The reason is
> that JUnit tests have always been isolated an we have come to expect
> that to be the case. It is quite convenient not to have to worry about
> restoring state between testruns so that testB can never fail because
> testA failed to clean after iteself

But if this were the case, @After would be pointless, wouldn't it?

How many of your tests would suddenly break if instances were shared?

In my experience, tests and developers already spend a great deal of
time cleaning up after themselves, which makes me wonder (as you
already know) if creating a new instance before each method is worth
the pain it causes...

--
Cédric
